result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevion L Carney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying Concealed Weapon. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevion L Carney

records.addlTxt: The Notes entry created on 09-27-2022 for assessment of attorney fees was set up incorrectly. Seeing as this is a CM case this entry should have been set up as a $500.00 AFTES (Attorney Fees Escrow Account), and not a $750.00 Attorney Fees Assessment. Only criminal felony cases get set up with a $750 AFTES. th

Assessment for attorney fees and costs in the amount of $500.00 entered as ordered by the court on 09/28/2022 to pay $25.00 monthly. Final payment due by 05/24/2024.  Failure to pay is a civil judgment.  Th
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    CHRISTIAN THOMAS  $490.00

Assessment for attorney fees and cost in the amount of $750.00   entered as ordered by the court on 08/08/2022 to pay $200.00 monthly. Final payment due by 12/01/2022, Failure to pay is a civil judgement. lj
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific month due dates for this ATYPP
Amended order appointing counsel; signed and filed.
Amended Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Trevion L Carney in court.  Attorney Christian Thomas in court for Trevion L Carney.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held.Case in court for  status Conference.  Parties held negotiations off the record.  
Negotiations placed on the record. Upon the motion of the County. Court ordered charge amended to 63.015, County Ordinance., to which Defendant plead no contest. Defendant found guilty of amended charge. Court ordered a forfeiture in the amount of $10 plus costs, to be paid on a payment plan, $25 per month commencing 12/01/2022.  Failure to pay will result in civil forfeiture/tax intercept.

Defendant Trevion L Carney in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Thomas is new counsel on the case.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.  Defense has received an offer and will receive an offer.  Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
signed and filed.
Order Appointing Counsel, forwarded for signature.

Defendant Trevion L Carney in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defendant provided the Court with Affidavit of Indigency paperwork. 
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Christian Thomas, upon acceptance, to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $200.00 per month beginning on 09/01/2022 and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Trevion L Carney
Current: 3955 N  Murray ave # 103, Shorewood, WI 53211   (Effective: 07-28-2022)
Prior: 3104 West Wells Street #305, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 8/08/22 at 8:30am, Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.

Defendant Trevion L Carney in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($500.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Trevion L Carney not in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Trevion L Carney in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court was not in session on 2/22/2022, due to the weather courts were closed. Court date for 2/22/2022 has been vacated. Case adjourned to 3/23/2022, at 2:00 p.m. in OCCR. Notice has been mailed.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/22/22 @ 2p
